Ben Nghe Street food Market is a place to welcome many Western tourists and other Vietnamese at home and abroad. Inside are the familiar dishes of the West and Ta such as Turkish food, Mexican food, Indian food. And more specifically, Ben Nghe Street Food Market has specialties of 3 regions of the country, which are Banh Xeo, Bun Bo Hue, Goi Cuon, Quang noodles, Cao Lau Hoi An, and other specialties for tourists to open their eyes and help other provinces experience many dishes in all parts of the country and moreover, help a part of the Western world to experience their own dishes. The price is also affordable for tourists to experience.
Ben Nghe Street Food Market thank you so much

column6:
Fantastic, seamless experience throughout from choosing fabrics > measurements > 1st fitting and adjustments > delivery to the hotel.

Choice of fabrics is vast and I chose a Wool / Cashmere suit, linen jacket, herringbone jacket and bamboo cotton shirts.

The staff are amazing and the on-site tailors made alterations whilst I was trying on other garments.

Yaly will deliver to your hotel and they actually beat me back to my hotel following the 1st fitting - even with a number of adjustments needed.

Emily was amazing and definitely recommend asking for her (although everyone seemed great).

This was my 1st experience of getting bespoke tailoring. Now that they have my measurements Iâ€™ll be ordering more once back in the UK.

If youâ€™re looking for a good tailor, I would highly recommend Yaly. You wonâ€™t be disappointed.

column6: Visited Tony the Tailor today after doing some research and saw it was recommend in an online article, and reading the reviews. Luckily my hotel was only around the corner, and I liked that it was away from the market area. I decided on a 3 peice suit and shirts. The shop had a family feel to it which I really enjoyed. I was guided expertly through choosing the materials, colours and cut, and measurements taken before given a price. I was very happy with the cost, extremely reasonable so I decided to go ahead. I went back in the late afternoon on the same day for a fitting and any adjustments. However, it all fitted perfectly right away. Very pleased with the final product, great quality and craftsmanship. I would thoroughly recommend.

column4: 81 Tráº§n HÆ°ng Äáº¡o, Há»™i An 560000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
An excellent tailor shop with a wide range of high quality fabric offerings. I ordered two suits (one navy three piece, one mid grey two piece) and a pair of linen trousers, all of which were finished to a high quality and with several fittings to make sure they fit perfectly. More generally, everyone there was so lovely, funny and supportive, and it was a really enjoyable experience all round!

For the suit nerds out there like me, Ba Bi uses a full canvas to ensure a good drape and durability (not all Hoi An tailors do this - make sure to check first!). They were also very adaptable in accommodating my more niche requests, so go in with with really clear idea of what you want and communicate with them. In my case, I knew I wanted a traditional English cut (slightly looser and longer), side buckle fastening on trousers and half-break finish at the leg, and they delivered all these very well. They also keep your measurements in case you want to put in future orders.

column6:
Lusi Tailors - Hoi An

We were pleasantly surprised by our experience with luci Tailorâ€™s. Our tour guide informed us that the city was popular for tailors, we walked into a store which was located close to the old town. The first question we asked was if the clothes could be prepared in under 24 hours, and they assured us that that was possible, we then went on to negotiate a good price and we were satisfied with that. My husband ordered three suits and a vest. He was measured and his suits turned out perfect the following day. I also purchased four suits for my daughter who is not traveling with me. We FaceTimed her, and then had her measure her self and communicate, the measurements back with us. The sales people at the Tailorâ€™s walked her through proper measurement guidelines. They had several books for samples, and they had really good material, lining, and our skirts and jackets were well tailored with lining material. Jackets came with the handkerchief. the next day we went in for fitting, I felt that the arm pit was a little tight on the jacket and they were able to adjust it a few hours later, and had it delivered to our hotel room. Overall, I am very satisfied and we received tailored clothing at a very affordable price. All the prices are open to negotiation, and the more you purchase the better pricing they provide you. The staff was very pleasant very professional spoke English well, always served us with cold water, and escorted us to the ATM for safety. The store had cameras everywhere. the ssles people are all family members and the factory has 40 tailors working around clock to deliver the clothes. Fabric quality is really important and this shop carries a large selection of fabric options and colors. If you tell them the weather, you are typically wearing these clothes they will help you pick out the right blend so that youâ€™re comfortable in whatever you are wearing.

column6: I was recommended Canali by my hostel in Hoi An. My initial experience was great. All of the women in the shop were incredibly friendly and helpful. I decided on six short-sleeve collared shirts. Only in town for a couple of days, I was assured that my shirts would be ready without issue. I came back the next day at our scheduled time and some additional adjustments were needed - I asked for the sleeves to be shortened and the chest on each shirt needed to be brought out, as the shirts were all much too tight. I came back later that night and one of my shirts was out and ready to be tried on. The shirt fit well and the sleeves had been adjusted. I was told that all of the shirts were ready to go. Shame on me for not checking each shirt. Upon arriving back home, I went to try on all of my other shirts and it was very apparent that the adjustments had not been made to any of the other shirts. I had to pay someone in my home country more than the initial cost of all of the shirts for alterations. I tried reaching out to Canali, but received no response. I would hate to think that I was intentionally deceived, but what was seemingly a great experience has turned out to be incredibly disappointing and costly.

We learned about Tina Design from our tour guide in Hue. She said it was a family business, very high quality, more about superb tailoring than Hoi An fame. We walked over on our first night in Hoi An, just to check it out. I thought I might get a new suit.

Thinh, Linh, Hiá»ƒu, and Tina herself were wonderful. We trusted them immediately, and enjoyed spending time with them. We trusted their advice and understood we were in the hands of masters.

Five days later I had four new suits. My wife bought a suit and a blazer, and our daughter bought a dress for her graduation ceremony - all perfectly tailored with multiple visits to ensure we were happy. They were quite busy every time we visited yet they made us feel special and valued.

The shop is just outside the ancient town, across from the Hoi An Museum. If we have any regrets it's that we didn't get even more...

column6: I wanted to have some clothes made whilst staying in Hoi An and after doing some homework in England I emailed a few tailors with my requirements. One stood out in their response and it was the one only 15 minutes walk from my hotel, The Palm Garden. Upon arrival I went and met Minh. What a stroke of luck. This was a small family run business and not one of the bigger tailoring stores in the town centre, it meant that I wasnâ€™t one of many customers and I was personally welcomed by Minh and his lovely family. We got down to business and discussed what I was looking forâ€¦two shirts, a pair of trousers and a very complicated Harris Tweed wool coat of my own design. We discussed the fabrics, details and prices for allâ€¦no pushy sales, no need to negotiate just very reasonable prices. I agreed to come back I two days for a first fitting. Well, when I did return, I was blown away. The quality was amazing and so much better than I have experienced from other tailors both in Asia and in England. We finessed each item, adjusting sizing and further details. When I went back to collect I was so impressed that I ordered more shirts and more trousers, ending up with 4 pairs of trousers, 5 shirts and the coat! I even did a last minute shirt order that was turned around in a day. I cannot fault the service I received, Minh and his family went out of their way to make me feel very welcome, from the warm smiles, hotel collections and drop offs, wonderful conversation and accommodation of my tricky requests! I really cannot recommend highly enough and if I could give 10 stars I would. If you are in Hoi An there is no better place to go. If you want quality clothes and fantastic service then look no further. My measurements are now on file and Iâ€™ll definitely be ordering again!

column6: Vorab - ich vermute wir sind einfach an die falsche Mitarbeiterin geraten. Uns wurde Sun von einer einheimischen Hotelmitarbeiterin empfohlen. Wir haben uns zwei Hosen, zwei Hemden und einen Mantel fertigen lassen. Die Beratung war lustlos, nicht wirklich hilfreich und auf Effizienz getrimmt. AnschlieÃŸend haben wir den Preis verhandelt. Dieser war letztlich in Ordnung, aber die Verhandlung eine Qual. Das kann man vernÃ¼nftiger lÃ¶sen. 24h spÃ¤ter haben wir eine Anprobe vorgenommen und hatten Ã„nderungswÃ¼nsche. Die Mitarbeiterin hat uns nicht eigenstÃ¤ndig auf mÃ¶gliche Verbesserungen hingewiesen. Jeder Ã„nderungswunsch wurde zunÃ¤chst versucht zu relativieren und wegzudiskutieren. Letztlich wurden die Ã„nderungen aber doch nach unserem Wunsch durchgefÃ¼hrt. Das Ergebnis: QualitÃ¤t und Schnitt ist nun gut und zufriedenstellend. Mit einer qualitativ besseren Beratung hÃ¤tten wir aber sicherlich noch bessere Produkte bekommen (ein abgestimmtes, zufriedenstellenderes Design). Sun cloth shop war wegen der Empfehlung unsere erste Anlaufstelle. Wir haben uns im Anschluss in anderen GeschÃ¤ften noch weiterer Kleidung fertigen lassen. In diesen war die Stimmung wesentlich besser, die Beratung professionell und die Ã„nderungen wurden eigenstÃ¤ndig von der Schneiderin vorgeschlagen. Weil wir wissen, dass es wesentlich professioneller zugehen kann, zwei Sterne Abzug.

column4: 479 Cá»­a Äáº¡i Cáº©m ChÃ¢u, Há»™i An 560000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
Toan and her daughter are incredibly lovely and provide a wonderful service with good attention to detail. It cost me just over 1million vnd (around 35 UK pounds) for a custom, floor length gown that was made to measure and incorporated exactly what I asked for when I brought my ideas in to them.

The shop is small, so you might have to wait a while if they are busy with customers, but it is worth the wait as they are a family-run business who are very good at what they do.

The only suggestion I have for first time visitors is that you should go there as early as possible on the first day of your stay so that they have time to make alterations to your clothing if needed especially if you have a particularly complicated design in mind. my dress was made very quickly (around 48 hours) and didn't need many alterations after the first fitting, but since my friend was having a dress made that was pretty complex, it took them longer to get back to her, which made it a rush to pick up on the last day of our trip. This was by no fault at all of the shop's owner or staff though, as they were very kind and amenable to my friends requests and our circumstances.

10/10 I would definitely visit again!

My wife and I have been using Dung Design Tailor for around 10 years. On our recent trip to Hoi An in mid-February, we had more clothes made. My wife got pants, dresses and blouses made while I got woolen trench coats, shirts and pants made.

Sim is the best tailor I have ever come across in Asia. The clothes she makes are first class quality and just last and last.

Dung Design Tailor is a family owner business with no pressure sales. Sim has a great eye for detail and has very good knowledge and great ideas.

I can't speak highly enough of Dung Design Tailor and Sim. The 10 year old clothes I still own are a testament to their quality.

column6: Outstanding service from the team at Vanda. I had made an appointment before my visit (highly recommend you do this to ensure you get the service the staff want to provide) but we were a little early and HuÃ© offered us water and showed us the fabrics available whilst she finished working with the current customer. I wanted some tailoring with my own material and also with theirs, and the process and explanations were through and clear. Returned twice more to complete the fittings - they were keen to ensure the tailoring was correct with their own fabric before starting with mine, which was a nice touch - and the owner hand delivered to our hotel on our last evening. Considering the amount we ordered (lots of shirts, two suits, shorts and a blazer) the turnaround time was amazing, without any of the important parts of the process feeling rushed. It is a little out of town (30min walk from centre of old town or a quick Grab) and not the cheapest in town - but the tailoring is being done right beside where you are ordering and getting measured, which means you really are getting a personalized service. On one of my visits, alterations were made whilst my friend had his fitting - thatâ€™s service you donâ€™t get in many of the tailor shops in Hoi An. Overall Iâ€™m delighted with the service I got for what was a very fair price. Huge thanks to all the staff but especially HuÃ©.

column6:
We had been walking around Hoi An walking into various tailors looking fro a place where I could have a suit made and my partner could have a couple of dresses made. It was hot and we were just about to resign ourselves to a place that we had found earlier that we were fairly happy with and go and get a beer when I decided to just walk into this place for some reason. Vy was very helpful straight off the bat but was more than happy to allow us to walk away and consider whether we wanted to commit to her store. We did eventually return and we were both very glad we did, I ended up having a 3 piece suit made and a linen shirt and my partner bought 2 dresses in the same style. We did have a couple of items made by some other tailors in Hoi An however by comparison of the finished product, professionalism, customer service and our satisfaction this place took the cake. Vy has my measurements and I plan on getting some things tailored and sent to my home.

Max.

column6: I had a wonderful experience getting to know the shop owner, Hanh, and ordering several items of custom clothing here. Frankly, I walked in at first out of curiosity because we were staying in a nearby hotel. At first, I placed a very small order for a pair of pants and a shirt. The clothes were produced quickly, and after trying them on, I was so pleased that I ordered several more pair of pants, more shirts, and a nice custom fit jacket. Of course, your measurements will be taken exactly, so the clothes are an exact fit for your body. I was very pleased with the styling choices made with regards to the clothing. And also I got to choose the fabric and the colors, of course. Of all the items I purchased, the pants are my absolute favorite. Hanh created a pair of what I call adventure pants that are made out of an attractive stretchy fabric and have several zippered pockets. They are really great and I prefer them over any other pants in my wardrobe. In fact, I purchased at least four pair, and I have intentions of ordering more! They look great, or a perfect fit, and are comfortable all day long. You canâ€™t really ask for more. And it was a real treat to get to know Hanh, and learn more about her story. It is a pleasure doing business with someone like Hanh.

Anna, the owner, is super helpful and is a fluent English speaker so it's easy to request custom designs and be specific about tweaking details. We got 2 x 3-piece suits which came with an Egyptian cotton shirt, ties and hankies. As well as a dress and trousers which they made based off of pictures we showed them. All of the clothes were ready for the first fitting within 24hrs, which was very impressive and they were very willing and helpful in making changes that we wanted.
Overall we really recommend and would use Sen Tailor again!

The tailors here do excellent and quick work, but as some others have said, be prepared for the staff membersâ€™ brusqueness. There is a large variety of fabrics to sort through, and a range of catalogs that you can go through if you need/want to for details or for general ideas. Very cool store. You need to get over the "rudeness" idea. Understand the culture. Be polite. Be patient. Understand that they may prejudge based on previous westerners.
If you are sincerely interested in buying something they're very helpful. They aren't friendly or warm and fuzzy. But they are nice enough. I recommend this store. Really great posters and other real cultural merchandise. Not crap. I bought 2 posters and a lovely water puppet. Good prices and they put the posters in a tube and wrapped my merchandise for transport.
They even allowed me to take a few photos of the posters after that.

column4: 04 Cua Dai Street, Há»™i An 0000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
I come to this tailor when I come to Hoi An. I first saw her shop in 2016, it was near the Victoria hotel, she made me a dress for my daughterâ€™s wedding which I still wear! Lan is a lovely lady and speaks excellent English so nothing will be lost in translation when you discuss what you would like.
Her shop has moved and is now opposite Boutique Hoi An Resort. The address is: 207 Lac Long Quan, Hoi An. We got a taxi from the Victoria hotel where we were staying. It is only a few minutes drive but too far to walk in the heat. She has a cafe downstairs and her tailors shop is upstairs, it is beautiful and very light and airy (see my photos).
She can make you anything from a simple top (take your old favourite and she will copy it) or take a photo of something you like. I took a photo of a maxi shirt dress I saw Amanda Holden wearing on a tv show and she copied that for $45. It is fabulous and a superb fit. She has a big selection of materials from cotton to silk but has small sample she can get too. She has a selection of garments you can try on for ideas too. My husband has had shirts made and they were an excellent fit. Most things are made in 24hrs.
Lan works very hard and wants to please. She will deliver to your hotel and offered to pay for our taxi back. I would get more made if I had the room in my suitcase. Please support Lan if you can, she is as good as the famous tailor in town but much cheaper.

column6: I went to this store on my last day in Ho Chi Minh thinking that they sell silk clothes. To my surprise it was a tailor shop and the lady offered to make something for me. When I told her that I am leaving at night, she said the item will be ready by 6 pm. Not having anything in mind I ordered a home shirtdress for my elderly mother. Although itâ€™s a very simple dress the quality is fantastic, I donâ€™t remember when last time I saw that well made item! The only regret I have that I didnâ€™t go there on my first day and didnâ€™t order more clothes. By the way, they also delivered it to my hotel since I couldnâ€™t pick it up. Two ladies in the store speak English and they take credit cards. Highly recommend this place!

column6: Stopped by on the last day of our trip to get gifts. What all the other reviews are saying still holds true as of the time of writing. The products (inter alia, notebooks, calendars, bookmarks, paper earrings, paper) are intricate and creative. There is also the tour of the paper making facility offered but we were unable to attend. Highly recommend. It is also situated on the train street, so you can plan your trip to coincide with the timing of the train. The lady managing the store also speaks fluent English so dont be afraid to ask her about the products. Great stuff.

column6: I bought a great suit from them which was made quickly and to a high standard. With so many tailors in Hoi An, what set Son Ca apart was the excellent customer service. The owner was so friendly, giving us free drinks during my fitting and was very happy to make adjustments. Unlike other tailors, it never felt like she was trying to make as much money as possible from us or rush us to buy anything. The final suit was just like the pictures that I had provided and feels very high quality. Would definitely return here if Iâ€™m back in Hoi An.

column6: Grace designs was a lucky and wonderful find! I was looking for a specific type of shirt and went in to see, and she had it in a different color but was able to make me one within two hours! I also admired a dress she had made and tried it on. She look a look and put in some pins to shorten it and take in the waistband and made the adjustments without taking any shortcuts in about 15-20 minutes. She and her husband were so kind and friendly. I just wish I had found her sooner than my last night in Hue!

I was across the road and I saw the LiMe sign and as someone who love the look and feel of linen I was drawn to have at the very least a look.
There is a range of jackets, dresses, shorts, shirts etc. in a variety of lovely colours on rails all made of good quality linen and you simply pick an item you like and they will duplicate it for you making any alterations to suit your particular taste.
What struck me initially was the pricing. Considering itâ€™s in a touristy area, I thought it must be a mistake. Under 500k Dong for a tailor made linen dress 400k for tailor made trousersâ€¦.. I was sold.
Measured up in no time, back the next morning for a fitting and collected that evening.
Highly recommended.

column6: Ana is a fantastic tailor and will always work towards what's good for you. We were recommended her by our tour guide and it helped narrow down the many choices in Hoi An. Like all tailors here it can be overwhelming when first stepping but Ana was never pushy and made sure to focus on quality over quantity leaving you with a custom piece that you are both satisfied with and love. It's the perfect place to pick up something unique for a reasonable price. If you are short on time, they are willing to put in that extra effort to make sure it's ready for you to pick up the next morning. Would recommend her to anyone whether you are looking for a 3-piece suit or just some light pants for your travels.

column6:
I am so happy to find Lin tailoring services and thrilled with the tailored clothing she made for me. She made me some trousers (very trendy, tooth they look like they come from Zara) a beautiful jumpsuit and a stunning long maxi dress. As I am tall with big hips, I can't often fit into jumpsuits and suit pants they sell in the stores. After Lin carefully measured me she ar r nahed for me to come back the next morning for a fitting. She did such a great job and no extra alternation needed to be made. I'm so grateful for such lovely tailored clothes, my new look and such a fast turnaround time. One of the best tailoring services in Hoi An, I highly recommend -
At this address. I'm so happy with her services that I look forward to ordering more prices in the future from Australia. They will send internationally now they have my measurements. Thank you again for such a great experience!

column6: We wanted to get 4 sets of glasses - for each of us while traveling in Da Nang. We researched "great" Optical shops and concluded that we would conduct our business at Khanh Hung Optical. While we emailed our perscriptions and PD in advance, we also took had the free exam onsight to confirm -- Yup, identical, so that is very reassuring. Outstanding service from before, during and after. What is most impressive is their focus of speed. The reading glasses and far glasses for watching TV on the hotel bed were ready overnight for both of us and the computer (short, medium) and everyday progressive (short, medium, and far vision) were prepared in 4 days vs their their promise of 5 to 7 days -- Wow! That is very impressive for people traveling on tight schedules. The selection of frames is impressive, though in my opinion, we had Khanh Hung Optical staff pick out the frames that best suited our faces since that is their business that they really understand. We are very pleased with their selection and the overall results - the low price, the fast service, the super great personalised service -- caring for you as a person. I guess that is why so many other people have highly recommended Khanh Hung Optical - and that is why we recommend them as well. Simply outstanding!

column6:
We were well taken care of here at Bebe tailor! My partner had a couple suits made and I got a few dresses made as well, including a wedding reception dress. They ladies here are thoughtful and very efficient with their work. It was more expensive than I had originally hoped for, but you do pay for the quality compared with other tailor shops in Hoi An. We visited another tailor shop per our host recommendation, and it was no where near as up to snuff. The ladies at Bebe tailor got things right the first time and altered based on our pictures and requests. I recommend knowing exactly what you want and being thoughtful about how you would like things to adjusted. They will provide their expert opinion, but be thoughtful and firm about requesting alterations that feel right for YOU. Simply request, and they will listen.

Overall, definitely pricey, but you pay for quality and it is a lot cheaper tailoring back home! And the customer experience was fantastic. They even assisted with sewing on buttons that had fallen off of cheap shirts we bought elsewhere. So sweet and kind :)

Then I used WhatsApp to call the phone number on the listing. The woman who answered came and found my wife and I in the old market and walked us to her sisterâ€™s shop, explaining she closed her souvenir shop to focus on her wholesale business.

But... this place is still closed.

column4: 343 Nguyen Duy Hieu, Há»™i An 51000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
10 years ago we visited Hoi An and had the most lovely clothes made for us. Fast Forward to 2019 and we went back. Minh Loan is still the most gentle beautiful lady who with her helpers makes clothes for you that make you feel special.
We love clothes from the 1950's, lovely Sundresses made in Linen, Classic Mens shirts in Linen. Cute Heart Necklined Dresses made in English Cotton. I have a mum tum unfortunately and Minh Loan made me tailored work skirts in Italian Fabrics that fit me perfectly and make me feel like a serious grown up. She has an excellent selection of Linen, we splashed out and had a Linen Sheet Set and Duvet cover made for my son. It is the best nights sleep he has had since we put them on his bed.
When you go to Minh Loan, take clothes that you need altering she will make them fit you perfectly again. Take photos of clothing you admire, she will replicate them. It is best to always go with a photo on your phone or printed out so then there is no confusion. Take your old favourite clothing and have made over and over again.
We took in over 20 Family members the week we were there and Minh Loan and the team treated everyone well, they show no judgement at the younger family members requesting short or revealing clothing, they just make it exactly as requested.
I also had some really lovely cushion covers made in a French Antique Fabric I took with me. We are so grateful for Minh Loan tailor shop as come home with clothes and home furnishings that suit who we are not what is in the shops.
Truly it is overwhelming the choice of tailors in Hoi An but do yourself a favour, get a tax to this Tailors, it is off the beaten track, it is a hidden gem. I am not going to mention prices but to say it is extremely reasonable and you will not be disappointed at all. We don't haggle here. We hope you love it there as much as we do. There is also a good shoe shop next door, Minh Loan will introduce you!
She will get you measured up very quickly, you come back to try on the next day usually and there is not much mucking about. If you have a child she lets them sit on the couch, use her wifi, gives them a sprite or a water and it is a very relaxed environment.
You can take your own material or use hers.

Absolutely Exceptional in all areas of service, quality, fit, price, design and personal attention to detail and customer care. Extremely happy with everything I had made. column6:
We visited Rit tailor off the recommendation of our apartment owner. We originally went to Bebe which is famous in Hoi An however we found the prices to be very expensive and the service wasnâ€™t great, none of the staff seemed that bothered to help.
When we visited rit we were immediately greeted by the lovely owner Oahn, She offered valuable advice and nothing was too much trouble. My husband and friend bought suits for a wedding, 4 work shirts and trousers and the quality of all were excellent.
Oahn has such a great eye for detail and was able to make suggestions and color match the inside lining of the suits perfectly. We were so impressed by the whole experience and loved meeting Oahn who was such a gentle caring lady. We would definitely recommend visiting Rit if you are after top quality tailoring at a reasonable price.
Oahn also saves all your measurements so you have the option once back home to order anything you want making and have it shipped over, a service which we will definitely be taking advantage of in the future.

column6: Binh Tailor is as good as the reviews you can see from before. Based on my experience he exceeds all expectations. Binh Tailor Takes the time needed to deliver you a fantastic suit for you while on your trip to Ho Chih Minh. He hit all the marks of a seasoned and well experienced espoused tailor that I have ever experienced. He was both diligent and meticulous but patient with â€¦well whatever I had going on at the time of a very busy trip. We scheduled 3 fittings that were well organized but not rushed. I felt my wife and I could take our time and not just speed through different fabrics and items that suited what we had in mind. I strongly recommend you see him and his assistant anytime you can for a suit, trousers, and shirts that will make you look and feel great. We are well seasoned global travelers, and he is by far the best tailor I have ever had. I will be ordering future items to include custom shoes. Thanks for everything.

column6:
We were stalked by Thien when we were wandering around Hoi An, chatting to him a couple of times. He said that he had a tailor shop in the Market and to come and check it out. We had a rather bad experience with another tailor in Hoi An, so we thought why not. Very glad we did. It was good fun chatting to Thien and Tam. I was going in thinking I'll just get one pair of trousers, and I came out having ordered two trousers and two dress shorts.
The trousers and shorts fit really well, and are super comfy. No all my other trousers feel as though they are a bad fit!!
No adjustments were required.
A fun and cut post sale story was I told Thien that I needed a phone case. He told me he would take me to a store but at that moment I didn't have the time. Unbeknown to me, he went and purchased one and cycled all over Hoi An trying to find me. It fit perfect, and he gave it to me as a gift. What a nice guy.

column6: I happened to come across Min Thu as I was walking the streets of Hoi An. They had a nice display of unique, leather womenâ€™s sandals on display so I decided to chat to the young lady about a pair of dressy sandals I was considering having made. I had specific requests regarding heel height and softness of leather and she quickly grasped my requirements, quoting a very good price for the full leather sandals. I was so happy with how they turned out that I ordered a second pair in another colour and a pair of black suede leather boots. All of these were made by looking and pictures of shoes and boots I liked, and with her taking precise measurements. The boots are amazingly comfortable and are a perfect fit.

column6:
An exceptional experience from start to finish. Suits and other clothes made to measure by highly skilled friendly tailors with no hard sell.

Both tailors used to work at a high end tailors in Hoi An before setting up on their own without the high overheads. They were recommended by friends, or I would never have found them as they are off the beaten track for tailors. I cross checked with Google and TA and was pleased to see consistently high ratings. Tailoring compared favourably with suits from Boss, Max Mara and Jaeger but made to measure. I wish I had brought some of my favourite clothes for them to replicate. They also made a suit for my husband and linen clothes. We were very happy with the finished result. From start to finish it took 48 hours. Andy and Fiona came twice to our hotel to check the fit, button placement length and for quality control. After the first fit we ordered more as we could see how good it is. Prices are also fair. Hope to pay a return trip and to order much more.

column6:
This was among the many tailor shops we came across while exploring the ancient town of Hoi An.
We went in and started talking to the lady whose name is Ha Ni. She was very friendly and professional and through a few back-and-forth questions she gave us a very good idea of the price it would cost us to stitch linen pants and a dress.
There were a lot of pictures of handwritten reviews and posters displayed inside the shop raving about the tailor-made quality clothes and the service. That was a good sign for us to be a little more inclined to consider the shop.
We stitched 3 linen pants of different colors and a crop top and waist coast. The fitting was very good and they finished the job in less than 12 hours. Altho, there was some hidden time you should account for fitting and any alterations you might need.
Ha Ni was very helpful in guiding us to make the decisions and trying on the clothes to see if the fitting was right. She is very helpful and kind.
Definitely recommend you stop by this store when youâ€™re in Hoi An.

column6: Our visit to the carving workshop was amazing! My 13 year old daughter and I love artistic activities and have always wanted to try carving wood so when we found out there was a traditional workshop in Hoi An we were delighted to sign up ğŸ˜ƒ From the moment we arrived we were welcomed by the friendly staff who showed us the galleries and taught us about the history of carving in the area. After exploring the many lovely pieces of art created by local artisans we were introduced to a master carver who assisted us throughout our workshop. We were served delicious refreshing drinks while we discussed the steps of our projects. We selected our wood, picked out a design, sketched our images with pencil and jumped right into carving. Our woodworking master was very patient and helped us whenever we had struggles. The interpreters were very cheerful and answered our many questions about carving and Vietnamese woodworking culture. Once our carvings were finished we were offered the option of painting them with acrylic paint or leaving them natural. My daughter decided to paint her carving and was instructed on the best techniques to achieve the look she wanted. I decided to leave my work unpainted, smoothed the carving with sandpaper and carved my initials on the back. Once our projects were done our interpreter ordered a taxi for us and told us more about art culture in Vietnam. Our finished pieces are gorgeous and we will be so proud to hang them on our wall at home! This experience was very special and we are very pleased ğŸ˜ We highly recommend this workshop to anyone who loves art and wants to spend quality time together! Thank you all so much ğŸ™ We will be back in the future

column6:
We arrived in Vietnam, (Ho Chi Minh) for our 3 week trip with a loose plan of travelling to Hanoi then working our way back to Ho Chi Minh, We had booked the first two nights accommodation, Internal flights and a Halong Bay Cruise. With nothing else booked we contacted Minh and asked if he could organise tours (Meekong Delta, Chu Chi Tunnels, Ninh Binh, Phong Nha Cave, waterfalls, Ba Na Hills, the Marble Mountain and Hoi an). Minh arranged all accommodation, travel, guides, meals and activities to suit exactly what we wanted to get out of the trip. The highlights of this trip where definitely all the great places we visited and the icing on the cake was the Cyclo ride around Hue with Minh and dinner at Banana Mango. The conclusion of our Vietnam visit was made complete by enjoying lunch with Minh in Danang before flying to Ho Chi Minh to get our flight back home.
Huge thanks to Minh, his family and his team for making our trip Awesome.

column6: We stumbled across this unassuming store in Hoi an old town and were delighted, enchanted and amazed by Uyen and her artistry and craft. She has an incredible array of handpainted silk dresses, tops, skirts and scarves. Uyen and her staff went above and beyond for us during our numerous visits to her store (about 8 in total ) and she created 2 dresses, a uniquely handpainted scarf and table covering for us. WE also bought numerous scarves, beads and tops. The comittment to quality and the artistic process is evident here and it is an artist demonstrating her incredible skill at its best. If you are looking for a unique, authentic and non-mass produced momento of Hoi an then look no further. The spirit of Hoi An and its unique art culture continues to thrive in Papillon Noir - thank you so much Uyen, you are incredible.

column4: 90 Nguyá»…n Thiá»‡p, Quáº­n 1 Táº§ng 3, ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh 70000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
We requested our private guide to take us to the best shops for lacquerware, she did take us to a couple where the quality was pretty good but the design poor, sort of curio shop stuff. Then I insisted to visit this shop called Nhu Y and she was somewhat reluctant as it was pretty far out of the way but I insisted.
And God it was worth the trip. The shop is located in a private house in a back street pretty far of the center, difficult to find but we discovered here by far not only the very best lacquer work we have seen but also beautifully designed items. The quality of some items is truly stunning, as for instance a big black box with inlaid mother of pearl extremely contemporary in its design, something you would expect to buy in a shop like Hermes for 10 times the price, or more.
The manager of the shop, Mr. Duc, speaks a perfect English and is truly a gentleman. We ended buying 15 or 20 items at reasonable prices for the fantastic quality.
In the shop I fell in love with a huge 2.4 meters X 1.2 meters panel weighing some 50 kilos and decided to buy it and to have it shipped to Europe.
I then found out that Mr. Duc was the most precise person you could dream doing business with, answering my very many emails each time immediatly and precisely. He sent me the pictures of the crate he built with his staff to protect the panel: fantastic! like the NY Metropolitan Museum or the Louvre when they lend paintings. He also organized the shipping and all that at the most reasonable cost.
Our visit to this shop ended as the best moment of our 10 days trip in Vietnam.

column6: I have been visiting Andy for about six years for tailoring in Hoi An and I am delighted that she has now opened her own business with Judy. Every year I visit to update my wardrobe - so I do not need to purchase anything off the rack at home. Everything is so beautifully finished and suited to my taste, fitted to my body shape and lifestyle. Andy listens and suggest wonderful ideas that suit me. She has an wide array of fabric choice and her prices are very, very reasonable. Judy fitted my husband for shirts and they were perfect and again beautifully finished. If there is something you would like, they will find exactly the right fabric. No high pressure - just a pleasure from start to finish. When I wear my pieces, I receive many compliments and people always ask where I got my clothes from. There are many places for tailoring in Hoi An but this is by far the best choice. Easy to find - close to the market and great restaurants. Avoid the big shops - your money will go further here and you wonâ€™t be disappointed. I highly, highly recommend.

column4: 29 ÄÃ´ng Du, Quáº­n 1, ThÃ nh phá»‘ Há»“ ChÃ­ Minh 70000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
Ordered 3 custom-made shoes. I only have 2. Now, they are completely ignoring my emails.

Summary: I sent a custom shoe back for a refund/exchange. Now, they will not refund my money, won't exchange my shoes, won't even return my shoes, or even respond to my emails. They are keeping both the money and the shoes. I emailed a bunch of times, but they've been ignoring me. I DO NOT recommend you buy anything online or order anything custom. ONLY buy it in store, where they cannot rip you off!

Long story:
About 10 or so months ago, I went to their shop in Vietnam when I visited a friend in Vietnam. I ordered 3 custom made-to-measure shoe with them and gave them my address since I was leaving Vietnam.

It took about 2 months and I got my made-to-measure custom shoes. They did not fit and were clearly 2 sizes small. I remeasured my foot at a local cobbler shop. I paid for the return shipping, which was very expensive. It took another month or so and they sent me my new shoes.

Two of the three shoes were good. It turns out one of the shoes still did not fit. Now, if I bought off the rack shoes at a department store, or if I bought these shoes on a discount/sale, I would probably just wear them. However, I paid over-budget to get custom shoes, fitted for my foot, yet it still did not fit.

I sent the team photos and they asked me to ship back the shoes for a refund/exchange. I sent back the bad shoes. They put me in touch with their co-founder but THEY HAVE BEEN COMPLETELY IGNORING ME.

Please do NOT make the mistake of ordering custom, ordering made-to-measure, or ordering online. If you are in Vietnam, you can check out the store. However, if you donâ€™t live in Vietnam, they might just take your money and ghost you.

Quite expensive, but decent shoes. But, frankly, dishonest company.
I wish I could get my money back, or my shoes. I wish they would respond! Unless you actually visit the Vietnam store and buy something on the spot, PLEASE STAY AWAY!

column6: My first trip with my girlfriend to Vietnam , the traffic here is so heavy , I don't want to say it is " crazy " . However , we ignored the bad stuff and only thought about exploring Da Nang . We did not go to Ba Na Hills as many friends recommended, we chose My Son Santuary and Hoi An, and the beautiful islands here. Vn's driver was always on time and provided us with cool water bottles, he spoke English to communicate with us , it is ok . I couldn't ask for more from a driver , what he did was always take good care of our trip . Thank you Qua Nhi for always driving carefully.

column6: We initially went to BeBe tailors to get a dress made each, but thought they were too expensive. Disappointed, we went to the Lantern Lady (to make lanterns) who recommended that we try Silk Town. The prices were excellent! Much less than BeBe, and probably less than either of us would spend on a dress at home, which wouldnâ€™t have been tailored. The staff were very friendly, helpful and patient when we were deciding on the design and fabric. The finished results were stunning! We had two free fittings which was enough to get the dresses we wanted, and we were even entitled for a third. Would highly recommend!

column6:
Last August when our daughter visited us in Vietnam, we took her to Hoi An and discovered Ta Ta Tailor through reccomendations from other expats. In one day, they were able to make 6 casual dresses, 2 jumpsuits, 2 special dresses for a family wedding, 2 mens suits and 6 mens shirts.
Their service was so memorable that when we had more family visit this month, we returned and again, they were able to make 3 mens suits 4 mens shirts, 5 casual dresses and 4 special dresses for another upcoming family wedding. They completed all of these in 2 days and delivered to our hotel before we left! We will never go to Hoi An without visiting TaTa & TiTi! They are always so wonderful to us and our family!

I went to Kim's place with a friend of mine to get a henna tattoo and we've been really happy with the tattoos she drew on our arms.

Iâ€™ve just had three linen shortsleeved shirts made here and Iâ€™m very pleased with the results.

I took in a shirt I really like and asked for it to be copied x 3. I chose three separate linen fabrics (linen is a great fabric to wear in the SE Asia climate) and paid a deposit. The shirts were ready 36 hours later and are a perfect fit and so well made. Total cost was approx Â£50 which I thought very reasonable for the quality and fast turnaround.

Truc did an excellent job and I will definitely visit her again the next time I visit HCMC.

Sorry it's taken me so long to write a review!!

Came here back in Jan, before COVID reared its ugly head properly.

Stumbled into this shop after window shopping/getting various quotes from other tailors in Hoi An.

There is, truly, no shortage of tailors in Hoi An. However, this was the first one I walked into where the service felt completely casual (in a good way) and the lovely woman I dealt with wasn't pushy at all. She completely listened to my requirements to what I wanted and was really helpful too.

Zen is extremely accommodating, she took me in even though I made my booking last minute. As a solo traveller, I am extremely grateful for workshops like Zenâ€™s that do not set minimum participants rules to conduct classes. Instead, she keeps her class size small to ensure personal attention.

I wanted to make a wristlet, I have an idea of how I want it to look like, Zen came up with the template and other design ideas to improve its aesthetic. Not only was Zen a great instructor she is also a good conversationist. We had a lovely chat while making my wristlet. I am now a proud owner of a wristlet I can brag that I made. I am so happy with this experience and highly recommend it to everyone. It is the best souvenir I got myself this trip.

column4: 48 LÃ² SÅ© HoÃ n Kiáº¿m, HÃ  Ná»™i 100000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
We were in Hanoi old town in August and our teenage son was after a tailored suit for 6th form. After looking at a few from the outside, Duc Nhat was our chosen establishment and happened to be about 2 minutes from where we were staying.
Our son was able to easily explain what he was after and we were offered a set price with a first fitting later that day and a finished two piece suit expected the following day.
It was a pleasant environment with plenty of choice of fabrics and materials and we were treated very well with efficient service, care and professionalism.
Our son chose the style, general cut, lining and other details, all guided by our expert host and tailorâ€¦ measurements taken, all choices made and deposit paid, our first visit left and excellent impression and a big smile on our faces.
That evening, true to his word, the jacket was waiting for a first fit and after a few, skilful movements of the chalk and an expert eye, the jacket was off for alterations and completion.
The following evening, we arrived to find a really lovely two piece suit waiting for us. Duc Nhat was definitely a great choice and we are very happy with the final piece.
The suit then traveled around Vietnam in its own bag for over a week and is now back in the UK, it is clearly well made and skilfully tailored and its new owner is very happy indeed - a very big thank you to Duc Nhat.

column6: My friend and I had a great experience getting custom leather sandals and shoes made. I have large feet and is very hard to find styles at home that fit me, so this was such a fun experience. Many of the stores in Hoi An have pushy staff and make you feel uncomfortable but the girls here were laid back, friendly and fun to work with. Their turn around time was fast and after taking measurements made adjustments so shoes were a comfortable fit. My friend wanted a sole with better support and they accommodated her request for this. Overall I highly recommend this store for custom shoes. I had four pairs made and would definitely go back if I return to Hoi An!

column4: 111/2 Tráº§n HÆ°ng Äáº¡o Cáº©m PhÃ´, Há»™i An 560000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
I have visited Bang Da Leathern 3 times now and own 4 pairs of shoes from them. They are absolutely amazing and I wear them all the time! The first time I visited it was a really last minute purchase and they made them for me overnight. The second time I had a pair of over the knee boots made and a pair of ankle boots which are great (I have tiny ankles and so can never get shoes to fit in the UK)

The last time was the most impressive as I didn't actually visit there myself. My boyfriend went to Vietnam in January and he visited the shop for me. The amazing team there sent me a video showing me exactly what measurements I needed to send to them. Then I sent them a photo of the type of boot I wanted and hey presto - they made them in a couple of days. When they arrived in the UK, they fitted like a glove and I wear them almost every day. I cannot recommend them highly enough if you are looking for some high quality, perfectly fitting boots or shoes! Thank you to the team at Bang Da!

column6:
We are Best friends from USA traveling together only for a week, we had decided to go 4 days starting from Saigon to Dalat and did a flight to Danang.

The trip from Saigon up to Central Highland and Dalat was amazing with their guides Mr Sunny and Mr Li who really good took care for whole trip about accomodation, foods, place to see . Can say everything were awesome and we were so happy and enjoyed every minute.

This trip you can be explored all special thing from central highland and historical that haven't to much tourist yet.

They're so great in accommodating good room, good local food and beautiful landscaping.

Thank you so much for great experience for us in Vietnam.
Hope we will do another trip from Dalat to North more days with you.
Would recommend this company to everyone who want to explore Central Highland from Saigon.
Best Regards
From Anna

column6: A friend and I came to the cave and spent a hilarious couple of hours getting involved in the sporty and active adventure within the cave. We missed the safety video which in hindsight would have been helpful as we did not know how to successfully stop ourselves as the bottom of the zipline (we both graciously crashed into the mat). We had a lot of fun with our tour guide who helped us get equipped with helmets and torches before we acclimatised to the cold water, swam 10-40m to the cave entrance and hiked in through a muddy pathway. The guide called out when we needed to slow down to get safely through the tunnel. We arrived at a mud bath which was very slippery but the whole group loved getting fully involved in the mud and we had a great laugh all together. If you do not want to get muddy, this trip is NOT for you. Then we went back out for a cold dip and to remove the mud from our bodies and clothing, before kayaking (which was a lot of effort after we had laughed so much) back to the adventure course. This part is optional but we stayed and did a mini zip line, a big dive into the water and a small assault course over the water. A very fun afternoon and well worth the price if you are with a good group of adventurous people!

column6:
A friend of mine recommended this shop. He had made his wedding shoes there. When I walked in, I was greeted and assisted by 2 sisters, Le and Tam. They were so helpful and patiently guided me as I chose my shoe design and leather color choice. When I went in the next day to collect my shoes, I was pleasantly surprised to see my new pair of shoes made EXACTLY as I had imagined. The workmanship was perfect. I was so happy, I ordered a Sling Bag. Again, PERFECT!!!
I'll be back to Hoi An in December and I will definitely get more stuff from you :)
Thank you, Le and Tam.
See you soon!!!

I have been to other tailors in HCMC, None can compare to Mr. Lam and his wife.
On my initial visit which was a Saturday afternoon, they were actually closed but Lam insisted that I go ahead and come in.
Then he dove right into finding out what I needed, once all that discussed he proceeded to take measurements of me in every way possible that you can measure a human body.
The next Thursday I went back for 1st fitting and I knew as soon as I slipped into the Egyptian cotton shirt, everything was going to fit me exactly as I had requested, and I was right, slacks and jacket fit perfectly and super comfy!
I highly recommend UKYS and Mr. Lam

column6:
While staying in Hoi An we met Alex who works for Shop 52. He told us that if we wanted clothes made to come to his shop. We decided it would be fun, so got some clothes made. We were happy with the product, my partner got 3 shirts made, and I got 2 dresses. His shirts were very good price, my dresses were similar price to Australian prices (~$50 a dress) but itâ€™s nice to have a dress fitted exactly to you, and unique! One of my dresses had to be adjusted 3 times but the ladies were very helpful and I was able to get my dress back in 3 days even with all of the modifications, which I thought was very quick! My other dress only 1 day because it fit perfectly!
Alex went above and beyond for us even when there was no benefit for him - he called us taxis when we ran into him on the streets, recommended good restaurants, etc! Thanks guys we will be back!

I wasnâ€™t expecting a dewey decimal system but even some basic alphabetisation would have been nice. Instead I had to sift through every single book in the English speaking section. I went seeking either a Stephen King or a Lee Child, two of the worlds most prolific and best selling authors - to no avail. However, if you want one of 12 copies of â€˜mr and mrs Smithâ€™ then this is the place for you. After spending so long in there I felt obliged to buy a book just out of politeness - until I saw the prices! I walked out hot, tired and disappointed. 2 mins round the corner is an entire street of new and used book stalls where the staff actually look up from their phones and talk to you. I found everything I needed and more there. I love supporting small book shops but this one is undeserving of any support. Do yourself a favour and give BOA a miss...
I would upload a picture of the primitive collection of extortionate books but as with many 2nd hand stores that know they charge way too much you cannot take photos. They say a picture paints a thousand words - which is about as many as youâ€™ll find in this â€œbookshopâ€

column4: 43 le Loi Street, Há»™i An 51000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
I stumbled upon this shop as I was having coffee next door. Given the area (Ancient Town) is reputable, and Vietnam tailors/seamstresses are known for great work, I assumed that this shop was decent. That was MISTAKE #1.

I was hunting for a casual dress for my brothers beach wedding that is approaching in Thailand. After discussing with the woman (who seemed to be in charge that day). The woman constantly says â€œwhy notâ€). She suggested that she had something great in mind...exactly what I wanted but she quoted me for $80 USD. I quickly explained that $50 USD was my budget. I showed her a picture of what I wanted and the woman obliged. We then went on discussing the color. I hemmed and hawed about which shade of blue to go with. Another woman who was shopping at the same time as me, started recommended things to me and I got highly distracted. The â€œWhy Notâ€ lady wrote up my receipt as I was in conversation. She charged me 1,560,000 VND ($78 USD). MISTAKE #2.
NOBODY MAKES YOU PAY IN FULL UP FRONT. Standard is 20% until you pick up your item(s). Again, I was distracted by not being familiar using Dong, and the other shopper who encouraged me to pay in VND. I realize, shame on me.
I, excitedly, went to pick up my dress the next day. The Why Not lady was less than interested in me when I approached (of course because she already way OVERCHARGED me and had my $ in full). She led me to a dingy dark dirty corner of the shop where she pointed to the dress folded over. As soon as seeing it, I knew this was not the style of anything I wanted to wear. When I tried it on I noticed
1) the material buckled in the wrong spots.
2) the dress was so ill fitted.

When I explained that I was upset about the fact that the dress didnâ€™t look ANYTHING like what we had discussed....The Why Not Woman cared less. She chewed her peanuts and never once tried to rectify the situation.
I later inspected the details of the dress (when I was out of that dark space). I noticed
1) white thread used for the blue dress
2) a sea green zipper was used for the back and was exposed
3) holes were everywhere where the seams were undone.

This whole experience was just awful.
When I went back to the shop later in the evening, I tried talking to the Why Not lady, pleading to get some money back (willing to leave the dress with her). I explained that I felt ripped off. I gave her cash in VND but she charged me more than what was agreed upon. She was so rude to me and basically got a huge attitude and told me she gave me exactly what I asked for. She yelled and she had a nasty look on her face while my mother, brother, and son stood there with me.
After walking away, I spoke with another shop owner in the area and thatâ€™s when we looked up Thien Thanh on TripAdvisor. We were surprised this place could even afford to be in such a highly regarded are of Hoi An. It was then that we realized they prey on tourists but do not care about the people or the workmanship, not to mention customer service.
I am ashamed that I didnâ€™t do my due diligence first and that I didnâ€™t see the red flags, but this woman was awful for tricking me and basically stealing from me and being uber rude to boot.
Below is the dress that I asked for and then youâ€™ll see a comparison of what I was given along with the flaws.

column4: 66 Báº¡ch Äáº±ng, Há»™i An 560000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
Downstairs is a retail store that sells colorful masks with Vietnamese designs and upstairs is a performance arts theater that woos tourists by the bus load.
We saw a few busloads of them trudge in to go upstairs as our kids worked on their own masks.

The store has the Master of the craft and his 'under study'. They give you tips and guidance on theme colors and brush techniques and then let you go. Mind you, their English language skills are down at the bottom.

There is an occasional look over the shoulder but to the greater extent you're in your own with your creation.

It doesn't take very long ... Maybe an hour or less of painting (and you could walk away and come back after the drying is done) and you would come out with something unique from Hoi An to take home.
And the whole thing is at a very reasonable price.

Disgraceful service.
Avoid at all costs.

column4: 03 Cua Dai Hoi An - Quang Nam - Viet Nam, Há»™i An 564070 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
My wife and I met the family on our first night in Hoi An. We popped in for some water at their E Mart & fell in love with them and their beautiful family.
We had the intention of getting shoes made later on that week but from looking at their products and samples and just having a chat we had a great feeling.
I first purchased some brogues and the next day they were ready and exactly what I had picked out.
We went on to order more sandals & shoes. Mine were a little tight and my wife's needed minimal adjustment with the straps around the toes but it was no bother, by the following day they were ready for pick up and exactly what we had shown from our pictures.
I highly recommend them and their beautiful craftsmanship. You won't be disappointed.

YNOT is a place that has everyday art, aka furniture and decorations made in an artisanal way by local Vietnamese craftspeople and artists. Visiting this store will remind you that beauty can be also practical.

Marie, Kien and their team are lovely, know how to listen and also give interesting suggestions concerning materials and design. Their products can be seen in their website, but visiting in person is well worth the time.

All in all, highly recommended!

This lady is one of the original dress shops, i visited fifteen years ago, when I needed lots of clothes made so I knew her prices, service and reputation for good quality garments was solid.

And she didn't let me down this time, making my friends shirts, shorts and a blazer that were top quality and fitted perfectly.

It is always daunting, with so many tailors now in Hoi An, but its worth search out Lan no 9 - ( 31 hoang dicu st ) address above is not quite right, but email address clothshoplan_931@yahoo.com

column4: 505 ÄÆ°á»ng Minh Khai Táº§ng 2 trung tÃ¢m thÆ°Æ¡ng máº¡i V+, Quáº­n Hai BÃ  TrÆ°ng, HÃ  Ná»™i 10000 Viá»‡t Nam
column6:
Good and fair price.
I was looking for a tailor who can create a woman suit, and not many are doing it. I have found the address of this shop on the internet. It is not in the city centre but you can take a taxi to get there (approx. 3$ from old quater).
They do not speak English at all but the staff have been really friendly and opened google translate on her phone to communicate with me. We have been able to discuss about the suit, the fabric, the delay etc with google translate and gestures, and it worked pretty well. It is also good to have a picture of what you want, it helps.
In 4 days the suit was done, and when I picked it up they even adjust the length of my sleeves as it was too short from my opinion.
They are not this kind of tailor who wants to swindle tourists so it is appreciated.

column6: We tried to pay by Visa-card and they said to us, that it does not work. My card was already in the device. We paid after that by cash. At home I noticed, that the money was taken of my credit-account,although they said that it did not happen. So, I have paid the clothes two times! I have contacted them by e-mail, and they admit, that so it has happened. Still, I have not get the money back, It was soon 3 weeks agow, when I started conversation with them. They answer something, kindly, and asked for instance photoes of receipts, and I sended them. Now , I just want you people know, do not use bankcard there!

column6: Highly recommend. Art studio, a place where you can have tea or coffee or do a workshop like I did. Had an amazing afternoon booked via Airbnb. Learnt about Vietnamese tradition, how to paint a Non La (the straw hat), listened to traditional music and enjoyed tea and cookies. If you want culture and to learn a skill, then this is a must. The class lasts for around two and a half hours (depends on your painting and how much detail you go into). The studio is really pretty and clean. Staff are beyond helpful. column6:
I didn't come to Hanoi planning to buy a suit. I had a couple of hours to kill and I figured it wouldn't hurt to get a few quotes. Duc Loi was the first place I checked out. Not only was their English excellent, but they were also friendly, honest, and patient. After realizing how affordable the suits were, I decided that I would quickly visit three other places in the neighbourhood to compare.

I ultimately decided to settle on Duc Loi. I couldn't find fabrics that I liked at the other locations. As well, they were not nearly as friendly or patient as the staff at Duc Loi. I ended buying two 2-piece suits and 1 tailored shirt.

I was able to get the suits made in under 72hrs! I ordered the suits around 3:30PM and the owner opened her shop at 9:00PM that evening just so that I could come back for my first fitting.

The suits fit perfectly. The staff are familiar with the most up-to-date styles for men's suits - what's appropriately fancy and what's gimmicky - and gave excellent advice. If you're planning to get a tailored suit, make sure you do your research beforehand (e.g. # of vents, single breasted or double breasted, stitching, extra pockets, lapel styles). I made the mistake of not preparing beforehand and had to google it on the spot. They were able to accommodate all of my additional requests: boutonniere hole, extra ticket pockets, extra internal pockets, etc. The shirt fit a bit looser than I was used to, but it afforded more mobility and comfort.

Overall, I highly recommend the store for their price, service, speed, and quality.

column6: It was raining this day in March of this year. Our cruise ship had docked and we rode in by bus to the city of Da Nang in Vietnam. We sat and drank coffee on small stools watching the scooters and motor bikes whiz by. My husband and I eventually ventured carefully across the street down the crowded sidewalk. When I saw the silk shop I asked my husband to wait while I explored the silk shop. The ladies were welcoming and spoke some English. I saw a lovely grey silk sleeveless dress. I have had so many complements. I wish I'd bought every colour. I am uncertain if there is an opportunity for that store to ship. I would order from them.

column6:
Small and understating storefront could be misleading to foreigners' eyes, but, this is a hard-to-find truly professional custom picture framer. I was so glad to discover this shop while trying to make and repair a half dozen frames for prints, drawings, diploma, and art object. Unlike most framers in Saigon, the owner has great artistic eyes and gives you excellent advice (in English!) for the choice of frame type, dimension, depth, and color. All frames came up with impressive quality. Price is reasonable, too. Only downside is delivery time. It takes 1 week or 2 -- not very convenient to short stay travelers.

A nice surprise was in the back of the order sheet, There was a clear statement of 'rule of engagements.' In Vietnam, everything is opaque and run by quick fix mentality, which leads to inevitable surprises. it is very rare to see responsibilities are stated clearly upfront on both customers and the store. It shows the professionalism of the store owner.

column6: Amazing service at this jewellery store, Van Tran is not only extremely knowledgeable and helpful (and speaks English quite well), but she's a lot of fun! If you like something and it's not your size, they'll make it overnight. You have something you want custom made, they'll make it overnight. You like something but want to tweek it a little bit, they'll do it overnight. Their prices are great - much cheaper than Mexico, which has a reputation for good silver. Bebe's silver is stamped .925. We ordered 5 custom pieces, and bought another 2 over the counter - delighted with all of them! Would highly recommend Bebe Jewellery!

column6: My husband saw the shirts at this shop as we passed by and liked the fabrics. The lady was very friendly and not pushy - a rarity in Vietnamese tailor shops. We had already been to two fancy big tailor shops in Hoi An for suits for my husband and myself (see other reviews) and weren't really in the mood, but the fabrics were nice - and most importantly the price for 3 shirts was under $50. So we thought "what the heck - give them a try". The shirts turned out GREAT! When we stopped by for a fitting and a few alterations were needed - not a problem - when we came back - the shirts were perfect - seriously! The arms were not too tight but very well fit, the length of hem and sleeves were well done and all in 24 hrs with a smile. I would definitely recommend this shop - I have no doubt they would do an excellent job on any piece of clothing - and probably for much less than the other places we went too!

column6: I traveled with my disabled mother and had bought my tickets 6 months earlier to my travels to secure a â€œproper scheduled itineraryâ€ based on my timeline. At the day of the event, I received a call from the tour agency telling me that the show I had booked was sold out (meaning that they misused my money funds for something else at the time) and that if I wanted ti se the show it would be the show earlier (20 minutes before the show began). Vietnam is heavy on traffic and attending earlier caused disruption and was disrespectful. Not only that, but The travel agent hung her phone twice on me and I had to Venture to see if I could attend the show I wanted to presence with my mother. The travel agent was disrespectful, unprofessional, and lied to us. Terrible service.

column6:
It's surprising that there aren't many reviews of this shop, because we found it to be the best place to purchase for souvenirs in the beautiful town of Sapa. ğŸ¥°

Tucked away in a nondescript street, this is a hidden gem in Sapa with beautifully handcrafted souvenirs at prices cheaper than the stalls at the night markets and other stores outside. The quality is also far more superior and there isn't much need to haggle for prices over here, which made our shopping experience all the more pleasant.

We bought several table runners and a few stuffed animals at very good prices. The table runners are made by the two lady owners of the shop and the workmanship is excellent. The shopkeeper is a very kind lady who even helped us flag a cab at a cheaper fare as the driver wanted to charge us extra to travel to Cat Cat Village (seeing that we are foreigners).

Do visit here if you ever come to Sapa! ğŸ˜†

column6: I found this tailor while walking around my hotel in District 1. There are loads of tailors in the area but I find the quality to be hit-or-miss. I've had some suits done by Byfas some years ago but this time I just needed to get a few pants done and the price they quoted me was really expensive (USD $120 for a copy of the pair I brought). I am so glad I found Sakura Silk as they made 2 excellent pants for me for about 1/4 the price. Ms. Quyen was my main contact and she is lovely. They even tried to fix a pair of pants of mine that had a hole in it (my copy pair and the reason i needed some new ones) but the pattern was very unique. She told me they would hold onto them for a future visit. When I picked them up 2 days later, I had a delightful conversation with Ms. Nga who is one of the staff there. I was delighted with the pant quality and workmanship (and price!). I will definitely use them again on my next visit to HCMC.

column6: Worked with Louise and her team to design and make my wedding dress. She was very helpful with ideas and very patient with my indecisiveness. She kindly took the time to explain about the different materials and effects they would give without laying on any pressure. Louise was very easy going with a great sense of humour that put me at ease. What I really like about the service here is that they make a mock up dress first for you to try, they were happy to make alterations and play around with the design to get it just right. I didn't feeluncomfortable asking for changes. I havent yet tried my actual dress but I have every faith that it will be beautiful. I will put up review and pics after.i would highly recommend these guys for a hassle free process.

column6:
We are traveling with a transfer stop. So we have 3 opportunities to shop our duty free quota.
If we shop at Sasco, we have to carry what we buy. So, shop in Ho Chi Minh and send in check in luggage? Buy on transfer stop, or order online and pick up at destination, no carrying or waiting in line needed.

Price and selection would be a key here, it seems
But Sasco do not have a webpage showing anything except brands.
And price, availability etc?
Company policy NOT to inform.
Online, phone, mail

Nothing

Reason? They can not, are not able to etc.

Then, after 3 days, 5 phone calls and a number out of service, the real reason.

Company policy. Come here and buy or do not buy.
This makes sure you can not compare prices, have time to think etc.
Classic scam.
Calling this policy serving costumers is a joke
.
SASCO Shop satisfies the ultimate needs of them selves, to scam you for money before departure.

Avoid.
Will update with price comparison for fairness if we have time.

column6: "My meaningful family vacation was a wonderful experience. The space was infused with a variety of traditional indigenous cultural colors. The food was quite delicious, and we even requested a BBQ and outdoor bonfire for a delightful birthday celebration. The weather during this season was also very pleasant. column6: Before that, I had known about Vietnam as one of the coffee capitals but had never tried the original Vietnamese coffee. Incidentally, a friend who went to Vietnam to work in combination with tourism bought me a Vietnamese filter bag weasel coffee of the HatA Cafe brand, its taste surprised me. The coffee has a subtle, deep seductive aroma, a pure and mild bitter taste, ecstatic with a sweet taste in the throat that will make me completely immersed in a legendary taste. Again subtly with a hint of Chocolate and vanilla giving me an experience that is not only refined and pure, but also leaves an unforgettable mark with its characteristic intense flavor. In particular, the delicious and convenient filter bag coffee is suitable for my busy work. How wonderful.

column6: Established in 1993, Mai Gallery is the first private gallery in Hanoi, Vietnam. Over more than a decade, Mai Gallery has cemented its reputation as a gallery successfully promoting Vietnamese Artists, and bringing them to international recognition. A visit to Mai Gallery will give you an opportunity to admire works by leading artists of Vietnam. It is a focal poin for people to develop and share their knowledge of the art and culture of Vietnam. Mai Gallery particularly relishes exhibiting the talents of young and emerging artists. With its extensive collection of art, Mai Gallery is always ready to provide art lovers with the best works of the best artists in Vietnam. Word has quickly spread that Mai Gallery is the place for art lovers.

column6: I was sitting with my dad having egg coffee when I realized his wallet was falling apart... I decided it was time to do something about that (since he would have continued that way indefinitely), and seeing as Christmas was around the corner, the timing couldn't have been better to find Virgo! I looked at their styles online and requested a custom wallet (the one with the wolf on the front). The woman at the counter (I'm sorry, I forgot your name!!) gave me a couple options (including printing his name on the inside). I couldn't have been happier with the service and quality of the product. I hesitate to say this shop is expensive because the value is so good. Yes, you might pay more than another shop, but I don't think you'd find the same quality elsewhere. The stitching is top notch, the leather is great, there are lot of little touches that make it the perfect place if you want something semi-bespoke. I'm already looking forward to seeing my dad's wallet for years to come!

column6:
We visited this shop in June 15 and made a series of purchases of both shoes and other leather goods. All prices were initially quoted in USD, however they are quite happy to quote/charge in VND also. The items produced were of a high standard and neither of us has any complaints about the quality. The girls were extremely friendly and accommodating to deal with - nothing was too difficult. In partricular my wife was able to have a pair of her favourite running shoes copied in leather which fitted her as though they were the old nicely stretched pair!
I bought a selection of sandals as well as a leather cover for my Ipad. All the items were manufactured in a very reasonable time with little fuss. I was even presented with a little thank you gift - a cover for my Iphone at no cost!
I highly recommend this shop to anyone travelling to Hoi An who is looking for high quality leather goods at a very reasonable price.

column6:
Wir waren fÃ¼r 15 Tage in Mui Nee, und hatten uns von den positiven Bewertungen beeinflussen lassen.
Herr Thinh ist ein sehr sympathischer Mann der auch gut deutsch spricht.
Meine Frau und ich wollen uns jeweils eine Sonnenbrille und eine normale Brille als Gleitsicht herstellen lassen.
Schnell hatten wir uns fÃ¼r passende Gestelle entschieden, wir einigten uns fÃ¼r die 4 Brillen auf einen Preis von 475â‚¬.
Nach nur 2 Tagen waren die normalen Brillen fertig, die wir nun 3 Tage testen konnten. Wir hatten von Anfang an ein komisches GefÃ¼hl, aber bei einer neuen Brille kann sowas schon mal sein.
Dieses GefÃ¼hl nahm aber auch nach 3 Tagen nicht ab. Ich stellte fest, dass ich nicht in verschiedenen Positionen lesen konnte. Bei meiner Frau wars so, dass sie zwar lesen konnte, aber die Brille nicht ordentlich zentriert war und Sie dadurch immer SchwindelgefÃ¼hle hatte. Nach 3 weiteren Tagen kamen die Sonnenbrillen an, damit hatten wir genau die selben Probleme, also QualitÃ¤t gleich 0%.
Man muss Herrn Thinh zugute halten, dass es ihm Leid tat, und er uns bat Ihm noch eine Change zu geben. Was wir leider verneinten, da alle 4 Brillen nicht zu gebrauchen waren.
Durch unsere persÃ¶hnliche Erfahrung wÃ¼rden wir den Kauf von Gleitsichtbrillen in Vietnam abraten.
column7: Sá»‘ 12 trÃªn 17 Mua sÄƒÌm á»Ÿ Phan ThiÃªÌt

column6: I needed a haircut as my curly, long hair did not go well in the heat and humidity of Vietnam. Was recommended to this barbershop by my Airbnb host, so lucky I was. Went in there, the boys were aghast at my decision and kept asking "Are you sure ?". Yes, I want a Vietnamese style cut. Had shampoo and scalp massage first (included) then Minh Viet went to work, he is a master at his craft. An added bonus, he is an amateur photographer and took a "studio" shot which he sent me later. An all-round fun and wonderful experience. If you need a haircut in Hanoi, DON'T go anywhere else....

column6:
Er zijn heel veel kledingsshops voor maatkledij in Hoi An.
Een bekwame verkoopster wist ons te strikken vooraleer we andere shops hadden bezocht maar we zijn uitermate tevreden met het resultaat en de prijs.
Van de prijs kan je ongeveer 15 a 20% afdoen en dan zit je wel goed. Het product is topkwaliteit en zeer fijn afgewerkt.
Ik heb een 3-delig maatpak gekocht en dit had een perfecte pasvorm, had het niet zo goed verwacht. Bijkomend heeft de vriendin kleedjes uitgekozen uit nieuwe trendy kledingsboeken die dan volledig worden nagemaakt en ook deze vielen goed uit zodat we verdere bestellingen hebben gedaan.
Er is veel keuze in kleuren en tekeningen, alsook in kwaliteit van de stof. Kies voor de goede kwaliteit.
Het adres is nr 263 ipv 269

column6: I went to Pin Pin on recommendation of some friends that had been there recently and I was certainly not disappointed. Lang was a lovely woman with excellent English.
